symbols.name: sap.gantt.legend.DimensionLegend
symbols.description:
Dimension Legend provides a template for two-dimension legends. This template defines the representation (shape, pattern, and color) of individual legend items and their corresponding meanings in both dimensions.

Consider that you need to create a legend where legend items represent both the type and status of an object. In this case, you can configure xDimention to indicate object types and yDimension to indicate object statuses. Assume that valid object types are "Freight Order", "Freight Unit", and "Trailer Unit"; valid object statuses are "Executed", "In Execution", "Fixed", "Planned", and Unplanned. You will have a three by four two-dimension legend containing twelve legend items. Each them represents an object in a specific type and a specific status. For example, a red square stands for executed freight orders.

properties.name: legendSpace
properties.description: Space between two legend items.

properties.name: shape
properties.description: A Shape instance that contains two sets of data, one for the 'x' dimension and the other for the 'y' dimension. The system determines the representation of a legend element according to its 'x' dimension and 'y' dimension values.

properties.name: xDimension
properties.description: Name of xDimension. Note that the Shape instance used in DimensionLegend must have a set of data matches this property's value. The data set contains entries specifying the representation of individual legend items.

properties.name: xDomain
properties.description: Valid values of xDimension. Each of these values has a corresponding entry in the data set that matches xDimension in the Shape instance.

properties.name: yDimension
properties.description: Name of yDimension. Note that the Shape instance used in DimensionLegend must have a set of data matches this property's value. The data set contains entries specifying the representation of individual legend items.

properties.name: yDomain
properties.description: Valid values of yDimension. Each of these values has a corresponding entry in the data set that matches yDimension in the Shape instance.

symbols.name: sap.gantt.legend.LegendBase
symbols.description:
Base class for all legend template.

This base class defines basic properties for legend templates. sap.gantt provides two basic implementations of LegendBase:

  • sap.gantt.legend.ListLegend - A list legend template defines the representation of a list of legend items and their corresponding meanings
  • sap.gantt.legend.DimensionLegend - A dimension legend template defines the representation (shape, pattern, and color) of individual legend items and their corresponding meanings in both dimensions

If this property is provided, the paint server definition of SVG is rendered. Method getDefString() should be implemented by all paint server classes that are passed to this property.

symbols.name: sap.gantt.legend.LegendContainer
symbols.description: The LegendContainer control uses the NavContainer control to handle hierarchical navigation between legend sections. The LegendContainer control contains an initial navigation page. Both the initial navigation page legend sections are Page controls.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Height of the legend navigation. When the height specified is smaller than a section content, a vertical scroll bar appears.

properties.description: Width of the legend navigation. When the width specified is smaller than a section content, a horizontal scroll bar appears.width of the legend navigation. When the width specified is smaller than a section content, a horizontal scroll bar appears.

aggregations.description: This aggregation specifies the title of a legend section. When you add the legend section to a legend navigation container, you must specify a title for the legend section so that the section can be identified in the initial navigation list. Otherwise, your legend section is not reachable via GUI.

constructor.description: A dummy constructor for Format. Do not construct a Format object; instead, call static methods abapTimestampToDate, dateToAbapTimestamp, and abapTimestampToTimeLabel directly.

methods.name: sap.gantt.misc.Format.abapTimestampInUTCToDate

returnValue.description: The output date instance

parameters.name: sTimestamp
parameters.description: The ABAP timestamp to convert

methods.description: Converts an ABAP timestamp that is in UTC (eg:"20150909000000") into a date instance.

methods.name: sap.gantt.misc.Format.abapTimestampToDate

returnValue.description: The output date instance

parameters.name: sTimestamp
parameters.description: The ABAP timestamp to convert

methods.description: Converts an ABAP timestamp(eg:"20150909000000" ) into a Date instance.

methods.name: sap.gantt.misc.Format.abapTimestampToTimeLabel

returnValue.description: The output time label

parameters.name: sTimestamp
parameters.description: The ABAP timestamp to convert

parameters.name: oLocale
parameters.description: The locale object has the time zone and DST info; this determines how the function converts the timestamp into a locale-specific time label

methods.description: Converts an ABAP timestamp into a time label to be used in Gantt.

methods.name: sap.gantt.misc.Format.absolutTimeToRelativeTime

returnValue.description: relative time information object

parameters.name: oTime
parameters.description: the absolute time object will be converted

methods.description: Converts an absolute time object into a relative time object, which contains the following properties: { intervalDays: * difference in the day segment between the target time and base time*, intervalHours: * difference in the hour segment between the target time and base time*, intervalMinutes: * difference in the minute segment between the target time and base time*, intervalSecond: * difference in the segment segment between the target time and base time* } Use this method only in relative time axis mode.

methods.name: sap.gantt.misc.Format.dateToAbapTimestamp

returnValue.description: The output ABAP timestamp

parameters.name: oDate
parameters.description: The date instance to convert

methods.description: Converts a Date instance into an ABAP timestamp.

methods.name: sap.gantt.misc.Format.isoTimestampToAbapTimestamp

returnValue.description: The output ABAP timestamp

parameters.name: sTimestamp
parameters.description: The ISO timestamp to convert

methods.description: Converts an ISO timestamp (example: "2021-04-19T17:13:10.000Z") into an ABAP timestamp.

methods.name: sap.gantt.misc.Format.relativeTimeToAbsolutTime

returnValue.description: converted absolute time object

parameters.name: iIntervalDays
parameters.description: difference in the day segment between the target time and base time

parameters.name: iIntervalHours
parameters.description: difference in the hour segment between the target time and base time

parameters.name: iIntervalMinutes
parameters.description: difference in the minute segment between the target time and base time

parameters.name: iIntervalSeconds
parameters.description: difference in the second segment between the target time and base time

methods.description: Converts a relative time object into an absolute time object. Use this method only in relative time axis mode.

Different zoom type for mouse wheel zooming

This enum is part of the 'sap/gantt/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'MouseWheelZoomType'.

properties.description: Do not support mouse wheel zooming

properties.name: sap.gantt.MouseWheelZoomType.Stepwise
properties.description: The granularity is a whole zoom level, just like the global zoom slider does

Different selection mode for GanttChart

This enum is part of the 'sap/gantt/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'SelectionMode'.

properties.description: Select multiple shapes at a time

properties.description: Select multiple shapes alongwith lasso selection

properties.description: Support multiple shape when pressing ctrl/meta key From version 1.40 to upper versions, support multiple selection without Ctrl key for rows

properties.name: sap.gantt.SelectionMode.MultiWithKeyboardAndLasso
properties.description: Support multiple shape alongwith lasso selection when pressing ctrl/meta key

properties.name: sap.gantt.SelectionMode.None
properties.description: No shape can be selected

properties.name: sap.gantt.SelectionMode.Single
properties.description: Select one shape at a time

symbols.name: sap.gantt.shape
symbols.description:
The sap.gantt.shape namespace.

This namespace provides the following configuration related features:

  • A base class sap.gantt.shape.Shape is provided directly in this namespace
  • A default selection shape class sap.gantt.shape.SelectedShape is provided directly in this namespace
  • All basic shapes corresponding to SVG tag are provided directly in this namespace
  • Extended shapes from tag shapes are provided in sub-namespace ext
  • Special calendar shape, which should be used in combination with the calendar paint server, is provided in sub-namespacecal

x coordinate of the center of the circle.

Usually applications do not set this value. This getter carries out the calculation using the time property as a base and makes some adjustments.

returnValue.description: Value of property cy.

parameters.description: Shape data.

parameters.name: oRowInfo
parameters.description: Information about the row and the row data.

methods.description:
Gets the current value of property cy.

y coordinate of the center of the circle.

Usually applications do not set this value. This getter carries out the calculation using parameter oRowInfo as a base and makes some adjustments to align the center of the row rectangle along the y axis. If you override the default value calculated by the getter, the alignment of the center is not guaranteed.

symbols.name: sap.gantt.shape.Definitions
symbols.description:
Base class for all SVG definitions. It is different from the svgDefs in GanttChartBase. It is a container shape and related to shape data.

SVG uses the 'defs' tag to represent graphic objects that can be reused at a later time. Currently sap.gantt provides defs like TextRepeat. Applications can also extend this base class to support more functionality.

Gets the value of the childTagName property.

The 'defs' element is a container element for referenced elements. The content model for 'defs' is the same as that for the 'g' element; thus, any element that can be a child of a 'g' can also be a child of a 'defs'. The 'childTagName' is the name of any child element of 'defs'.

symbols.name: sap.gantt.shape.ext.TextRepeat
symbols.description: A TextRepeat definition shape is used to define graphic objects which can be replicated ("tiled") at fixed intervals in the x and y axes to cover the areas to be painted. The text patterns are defined using a 'pattern' element and then referenced by the 'fill' and 'stroke' properties on a given graphics element to indicate that the element will be filled or stroked with the referenced pattern.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID of the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Creates and initializes a repeatable text pattern defined for later reuse.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

symbols.name: sap.gantt.shape.ext.ubc.UtilizationBarChart
symbols.description:
UBC is a complex shape. This class is the outer container with tag='g'. All fragments are aggregated into this container. You can remove a fragment from the container if your application does not need it.

The container has six aggregations:

  • sap.gantt.shape.ext.ubc.UbcOverCapacityZonePolygon(used to represent the OverCapacity Zone area),
  • sap.gantt.shape.ext.ubc.UbcUnderCapacityZonePolygon(used to represent the Unplanned Capacity area),
  • sap.gantt.shape.ext.ubc.UbcShortageCapacityPolygon(used to the draw Shortage area),
  • sap.gantt.shape.ext.ubc.UbcUsedPolygon(used to represent the HealthyPlanned Capacity area),
  • sap.gantt.shape.ext.ubc.UbcBorderPath(used to represent the planned capacity line),
  • sap.gantt.shape.ext.ubc.UbcTooltipRectangle(used to represent a rectangle with invisible tooltips for each period of capacity change).

A super class sap.gantt.shape.ext.ubc.UbcPolygon is abstracted because the four polygons in this container (UbcOverCapacityZonePolygon, UbcUnderCapacityZonePolygon, UbcShortageCapacityPolygon, and UbcUsedPolygon) share similar logic.

Graphic Effect is:

An example of the structure of data to feed utilization bar chart:
{ bc_capacity: { id: "capacity_0", period: [ { start_date: "20160123000000", supply: "9", demand: "7" },{ start_date: "20160127093400", supply: "8", demand: "8" } ] }, bc_tooltip: [ { start_date: "20160123000000", supply: "9", demand: "7", end_date: "20160127093400" },{ start_date: "20160127093400", supply: "8", demand: "8", start_date: "20160203134520" } ] }

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID of the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

symbols.name: sap.gantt.shape.ext.ulc.UlcDimension
symbols.description:
This shape is a container for sap.gantt.shape.ext.ulc.UlcBorderPath, sap.gantt.shape.ext.ulc.UlcOverClipRectangle, sap.gantt.shape.ext.ulc.UlcUnderClipRectangle, sap.gantt.shape.ext.ulc.UlcClipPath, sap.gantt.shape.ext.ulc.UlcClipingPath.

For each dimension, it has two colors, one is OverCapacity and the other is UnderCapacity. When the UlcClipPath of a dimension and UlcOverClipRectangle overlap, which means the utilization rate is above 100%, the overlapped part will be colored by OverCapacity. The overlapped part of UlcClipPath and UlcUnderClipRectangle is colored by UnderCapacity.

UlcClipingPath is aggregated in UlcClipPath. UlcClipingPath and UlcBorderPath share the same value of property 'd'. UlcBorderPath is used to visualize the dimension line.

Gets the value of property stroke.

Standard SVG 'stroke' attribute. Note: You can provide the stroke with HTML colors and the URL reference to a paint server. Paint server definitions can be retrieved from paint servers rendered by sap.gantt.GanttChartContainer, sap.gantt.GanttChartWithTable, or sap.gantt.GanttChart.

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: Shape data.

parameters.name: oRowInfo
parameters.description: Information about the row and the row data.

methods.description:
Gets the value of property x1.

x coordinate of the start of the line.

Usually an application does not configure this value. Instead, the getter calculates the value of x1 by using the view boundary for the visible area in the Gantt Chart.

methods.name: getX2

returnValue.description: Value of property x2.

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: Shape data.

parameters.name: oRowInfo
parameters.description: Information about the row and the row data.

methods.description:
Gets the value of property x2.

x coordinate of the end of the line.

Usually an application does not configure this value. Instead, the getter calculates the value of 'x2' by using the view boundary's terminal point, which is filtered by the visible area in a Gantt Chart.

methods.name: getY1

returnValue.description: Value of property y1.

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: Shape data.

parameters.name: oRowInfo
parameters.description: Information about the row and the row data.

methods.description:
Gets the value of property y1.

y coordinate of the start of the line.

At the top of each row, a certain amount of space (in the shape of a rectangular frame) is reserved for over capacity area. You can use 'maxVisibleRatio' in 'shapeConfig' to specify the amount of area to reserve. With the reserved area deducted from a row, the height of the middle line is set to 50% of the row height.

methods.name: getY2

returnValue.description: Value of property y2.

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: Shape data.

parameters.name: oRowInfo
parameters.description: Information about the row and the row data.

methods.description:
Gets the value of property y2.

y coordinate of the end of the line.

y2 shares the same value with y1.

symbols.name: sap.gantt.shape.ext.ulc.UtilizationLineChart
symbols.description:
ULC is a complex shape. This class is the outer container with tag='g'. All fragments are aggregated into this container. You can remove a fragment from the container if your application does not need it.

The container has four aggregations:

  • sap.gantt.shape.ext.ulc.UlcMiddleLine(used to draw a middle line, which indicates the position of 50% utilization rate),
  • sap.gantt.shape.ext.ulc.UlcOverCapacityZoneRectangle(used to draw over capacity Zone),
  • sap.gantt.shape.ext.ulc.UlcDimension(used to draw Dimensions, OverCapacityClipping, and UnderCapacityClipping),
  • sap.gantt.shape.ext.ulc.UlcTooltipRectangle(used to draw invisible tooltip rectangles for each period of capacity change).

Each dimension consists of UlcOverClipRectangle, UlcUnderClipRectangle, UlcClipPath, and UlcBorderPath. UlcClipingPath is aggregated in UlcClipPath.

A super class sap.gantt.shape.ext.ulc.UlcRectangle is abstracted because the other four rectangles(UlcOverCapacityZoneRectangle, UlcOverClipRectangle, UlcUnderClipRectangle, and UlcTooltipRectangle) share similar logic.

Graphic Effect is:

An example for the structure of data to feed utilization chart:
{ order: [{ id: "ulc_0", util: [ { dimension: "util_volumn", values:[ { from: "20160123000000", to: "20160123000000", firstOne: true, value: 0 }, { from: "20160124071000", to: "20160124071000", value: 97.6 }, { from: "20160124071000", to: "20160127051300", firstOne: true, value: 97.6 },{ from: "20160127051300", to: "20160127051300", value: 97.6 },{ from: "20160128093312", to: "20160128093312", lastOne: true, value: 0 } ] },{ dimension: "util_mass", values:[ { from: "20160123000000", to: "20160123000000", firstOne: true, value: 0 } { from: "20160124071000", to: "20160124071000", value: 114.5 }, { from: "20160124071000", to: "20160127051300", value: 114.5 },{ from: "20160127051300", to: "20160127051300", value: 114.5 },{ from: "20160128093312", to: "20160128093312", lastOne: true, value: 0 } ] } ] }], tooltip: [ { from: "20160123000000", to: "20160124071000", firstOne: true, util_volumn: { previous: 0, next: 97.6 }, util_mass:{ previous: 0, next: 114.5 } },{ from: "20160124071000", to: "20160127051300", util_volumn: { val: 97.6 }, util_mass:{ val: 114.5 } },{ from: "20160127051300", to: "20160128093312", lastOne: true, util_volumn: { previous: 97.6, next: 0 }, util_mass:{ previous: 114.5, next: 0 } } ] }

symbols.name: sap.gantt.shape.Shape
symbols.description:
Base class for all shape classes.

Shape class is designed to describe how data should be visualized by an SVG tag. Most shape classes contain only properties and only one aggregation:

  • Some properties come from standard SVG attribute. Examples are fill, stroke etc.
  • Some properties designed to put Shape class into Gantt chart's coordinate system, especially the X axis called sap.gantt.misc.AxisTime. Examples are time, endTime etc.
  • Some properties are designed to provide some geometry attributes. Examples are side, center in some extend shapes.
  • Every shape has aggregation called selectedShape to provide a way to specify how selection of the shape should be designed.
  • Some container shapes like g and clippath has aggregation to aggregate other shapes in.

Because d3 is used underneath and d3 use array to do batch data-binding, therefore Shape classes are not designed in the way of SAPUI5 standard data-binding (one shape instance per data). Instead, each Shape instance stands for a particular way of visualize one data structure. And one Shape instance is used to draw a list of data by Drawers in Gantt chart.

Because of this specialty, application cannot instantiate a shape class directly. Instead they can use configuration sap.gantt.config.Shape to describe which Shape class is used to draw which data in what way. And pass this configuration to Gantt chart control by property shapes. Gantt chart control use these configurations to instatiate Shape instances and Drawers. Drawers consumes Shape instances to draw real SVG shapes.

Each shape classes are designed to support 'configuration-first' principle. So called configure is the shapeProperties property of sap.gantt.config.Shape. In this object property, application can provide following things:

  • A value. Example: {tooltip: 'svg rocks'}.
  • An attribute from data. Example: {time: {startTime}}
  • A formatted attribute from data. Example: {tooltip: "{time:Timestamp} the stock price falls to {price:Number}."} The typed numeric values for the key number are formatted by the configurations provided by sap.ui.core.format.NumberFormat, and the date and time values for the key timestamp are formatted by the configurations provided by sap.gantt.misc.Format.

In many applications, simple configuration or even binding cannot meet business requriement. Therefore applications are allowed to extend shapes and provide their own getter methods to effect all properties by data. For in row shapes, two parameters are injected to help application to do coding. All the shapes provided by Gantt chart follows 'configuration first' principle by invoking method _configFirst(). Meaning if application provide value by sap.gantt.config.Shape, the configuration over-write code logic in getters.

Note: Setter methods are only used for set default values. Because a Shape instance stands for a way of drawing. The instance self does not hold any status (property values). Meanwhile, all getter are injected with actual data and related informations to adapt to d3 paradigm.

aggregations.name: resizeShadowShape
aggregations.description:
Resize Shadow Shape.

Resize Shadow shape specifies how to draw the shadow highlight when resizing. Applications can implement it by extending sap.gantt.shape.ResizeShadowShape and configure it in sap.gantt.config.Shape.

aggregations.name: selectedShape
aggregations.description:
Selected Shape.

Selected shape specifies how to draw the selection high-light. Application can implement it by extending sap.gantt.shape.SelectedShape and configure it in sap.gantt.config.Shape.

parameters.name: sClassName
parameters.description: Name of the class being created

parameters.name: oClassInfo
parameters.description: Object literal with information about the class

parameters.name: FNMetaImpl
parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class

methods.description:
Creates a new subclass of class sap.gantt.shape.Shape with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo.

oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in sap.ui.core.Element.extend.

methods.name: getIsBulk

returnValue.description: Value of property isBulk.

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: Shape data.

parameters.name: oRowInfo
parameters.description: Information of the row and row data.

methods.description:
Gets current value of property isBulk.

Gantt chart do filtering of data by timestamp for performance sake. For simple shapes which has time or endTime provided, set this flag to false. For shapes (path or polygon) which connect a list of data, set this value to false. And if filtering is required to next level data, provide arrayAttribute, timeFilterAttribute and endTimeFilterAttribute in combination.

methods.name: getIsDuration

returnValue.description: Value of property isDuration.

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: Shape data.

parameters.name: oRowInfo
parameters.description: Information of the row and row data.

methods.description:
Gets current value of property isDuration.

When this flag is set to true, the shape is called 'duration shape'. And time stands for startTime, endTime stands for end time. When this flag is set to be false, the shape is called 'transient shape'. And only time is used. Usually these 3 properties are used to determine x position of one shape.

parameters.description: Shape data.

methods.description:

Retrieves the parent shape's referenceId.

The referenceId, which is related to shape data, is generated by a Group shape. Aggregation shapes can use this method to retrieve the referenceId.

methods.name: getResizeShadowShape
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation resizeShadowShape.

Resize Shadow Shape.

Resize Shadow shape specifies how to draw the shadow highlight when resizing. Applications can implement it by extending sap.gantt.shape.ResizeShadowShape and configure it in sap.gantt.config.Shape.

methods.name: getRotationAngle

returnValue.description: Value of property rotationAngle.

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: Shape data.

parameters.name: oRowInfo
parameters.description: Information of the row and row data.

methods.description:
Gets current value of property rotationAngle.

This value is used in combination of property rotationCenter. By providing both shape can be rotated with any angle around rotation center.

methods.name: getRotationCenter

returnValue.description: Value of property rotationCenter.

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: Shape data.

parameters.name: oRowInfo
parameters.description: Information of the row and row data.

methods.description:
Gets current value of property rotationCenter.

This value is used in combination of property rotationAngle. By providing both shape can be rotated with any angle around rotation center. Default implementation is the coordinate at time in x coordinate, and rowYCenter in y coordinate. If application over-write this property by configuration or code, the logic cannot be guaranteed.

methods.name: getRowYCenter

returnValue.description: Value of property rowYCenter.

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: Shape data.

parameters.name: oRowInfo
parameters.description: Information of the row and row data.

methods.description:
Gets current value of property rowYCenter.

Default implementation is return the middle position of the row in y direction. If application over-write this property by configuration or code, the logic cannot be guaranteed.

methods.name: getSelectedShape
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation selectedShape.

Selected Shape.

Selected shape specifies how to draw the selection high-light. Application can implement it by extending sap.gantt.shape.SelectedShape and configure it in sap.gantt.config.Shape.

methods.name: getShapeViewBoundary

returnValue.description: View boundary for visible area in Gantt Chart.

methods.description: This method is used to get view boundary for visible area in Gantt Chart. The view boundary is a range of x-coordinate for visible area.

methods.name: getTransform

returnValue.description: Value of property transform.

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: Shape data.

parameters.name: oRowInfo
parameters.description: Information of the row and row data.

methods.description:
Gets current value of property transform.

Standard SVG 'transform' attribute. Some logic in getTransform() is provided to enable property rotationCenter and rotationAngle. If application over-write this property by configuration or coding, rotation behavior cannot be guaranteed.

methods.name: getXBias

returnValue.description: Value of property xBias.

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: Shape data.

parameters.name: oRowInfo
parameters.description: Information of the row and row data.

methods.description:
Gets current value of property xBias.

Fine-tune x coordinate. This value only works for category inRowShape. Shape usually determines position in x coordinate by property isDuration, time and endTime. Application can use this property to do some x coordinate adjustment in pixel. The xBias will be automatically mirrored for RTL mode. It means if you set 10 to property xBias, in RTL mode, the value of the xBias will be -10.

methods.name: getYBias

returnValue.description: Value of property yBias.

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: Shape data.

parameters.name: oRowInfo
parameters.description: Information of the row and row data.

methods.description:
Gets current value of property yBias.

Fine-tune y coordinate. This value only works for category inRowShape. Y coordinate is automatically determined by row. Application can use this property to do some y coordinate adjustment in pixel.

symbols.title: abstract class sap.gantt.shape.Shape
symbols.subTitle: Deprecated in version: 1.64
symbols.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.64. replaced by sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape.

symbols.name: sap.gantt.shape.ShapeCategory
symbols.description:
Shape Categories.

Different categories use different Drawers. Therefore, different categories may have different designs of parameters in their getter methods.

This enum is part of the 'sap/gantt/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'shape.ShapeCategory'.

properties.name: sap.gantt.shape.ShapeCategory.InRowShape
properties.description: Shapes attached to one row.

properties.name: sap.gantt.shape.ShapeCategory.Relationship
properties.description: Relationship shapes connecting two in-row shape instances.

symbols.title: enum sap.gantt.shape.ShapeCategory

symbols.name: sap.gantt.shape.Text
symbols.description: Text shape class using SVG tag 'text'. This shape is usually used to represent points in time.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Creates and initializes a new Text class.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

methods.name: sap.gantt.shape.Text.extend

returnValue.description: Created class / constructor function

parameters.name: sClassName
parameters.description: Name of the class being created

parameters.name: oClassInfo
parameters.description: Object literal with information about the class

parameters.name: FNMetaImpl
parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class

methods.description:
Creates a new subclass of class sap.gantt.shape.Text with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo.

oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in sap.gantt.shape.Shape.extend.

methods.name: getEllipsisWidth

returnValue.description: Value of property ellipsisWidth.

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: Shape data.

parameters.name: oRowInfo
parameters.description: Information about the row and the row data.

methods.description:
Gets the value of property ellipsisWidth.

Ellipsis width if truncate happens. Default value 12 indicates 12px length reserved for ellipsis. If the value is -1, no ellipsis appears even truncate happens. If the value is bigger than -1, ellipsis will be 3 dots in length of this value.

Usually applications do not set this value. This getter carries out the calculation using property time. If you override the default value calculated by the getter, the alignment of the center is not guaranteed.

y coordinate of the bottom-left corner of the rectangle.

Usually applications do not set this value. This getter carries out the calculation using parameter oRowInfo and property height to align the center of the row rectangle along the y axis. If you override the default value calculated by the getter, the alignment of the center is not guaranteed.

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.AdhocLine
symbols.description: The AdhocLine class contains properties to draw an additional vertical line at specific time points in the chart area. You can use this line to mark milestones, such as the start of a project start, and special events, such as holidays.

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.BaseCalendar
symbols.description:
BaseCalendar shape.

The Calendar shape can either be used in combination with Calendar def class sap.gantt.def.cal.Calendar which draws the SVG 'defs' tag, or it can be used as a standalone shape with time and end time defined.

properties.name: calendarName
properties.description: Calendar name is used to map the base calendar with its calendar definition pattern. Do not set this property if you do not want to reuse the calendar definition across rows, and you want row wise different calendars. Instead set the time, endtime and fill the properties for the calendar shape. Providing values for calendarName, and time or endTime is considered as invalid. In such cases, time or endTime are ignored even if the calendarName is not available in calendar definitions.

properties.name: fill
properties.description:
Fill for calendar shape

Since: 1.134.

properties.name: stroke
properties.description:
stroke for the calendar shape

Since: 1.134.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID of the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Creates a calendar shape that either consumes pattern from calendar in the 'def' package as the "calendarName" property is defined, or, it exists as any other instance of BasShape with defined relevant properties.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in sap.gantt.simple.BaseRectangle.extend.

methods.name: getCalendarName

returnValue.description: Value of property calendarName

methods.description:
Gets current value of property calendarName.

Calendar name is used to map the base calendar with its calendar definition pattern. Do not set this property if you do not want to reuse the calendar definition across rows, and you want row wise different calendars. Instead set the time, endtime and fill the properties for the calendar shape. Providing values for calendarName, and time or endTime is considered as invalid. In such cases, time or endTime are ignored even if the calendarName is not available in calendar definitions.

returnValue.description: Value of property fill

methods.description:
Gets current value of property fill.

Fill for calendar shape

Default value is "sapChart_Sequence_Neutral_Plus2".

methods.description: Gets current value of property x. If calendarName property is set then return 0 else if the time or endTime (in RTL mode) is present, return the x coordinate of the value correposning to the start time of the Calendar interval.

methods.name: setCalendarName

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sCalendarName
parameters.description: New value for property calendarName

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property calendarName.

Calendar name is used to map the base calendar with its calendar definition pattern. Do not set this property if you do not want to reuse the calendar definition across rows, and you want row wise different calendars. Instead set the time, endtime and fill the properties for the calendar shape. Providing values for calendarName, and time or endTime is considered as invalid. In such cases, time or endTime are ignored even if the calendarName is not available in calendar definitions.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.BaseConditionalShape
symbols.description: A conditional shape renders one of the sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape shapes assigned to it using the activeShape property. This allows you to switch between shapes based on properties from data binding.

properties.name: activeShape
properties.description: Defines which shape from the shapes aggregation is visible. If you specify a negative value or a value that is greater than the number of shapes defined, no shape will be rendered.

properties.name: countInBirdEye
properties.description:
Specifies whether or not the system takes this shape into account at the bird's eye zoom level.
We suggest that you set this property to true only for shapes that really need to be considered when in the bird's eye view.

This property is overwritten by property countInBirdEye of the activeShape shape from the shapes aggregation.
For setting this property, use the setter method of the active shape. The getter method returns the property value of the active shape.

aggregations.name: shapes
aggregations.description: A list of base shapes to switch between. Only one of these shapes will be rendered based on the activeShape property. Incase if aggregation is bound to listbinding,this aggregation will includes only active shape instance.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID of the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

Creates and initializes a new BaseConditionalShape class for a simple Gantt chart.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.BaseDeltaRectangle
symbols.description: BaseDeltaRectangle represents a basic shape that creates rectangles. It is defined by corner positions, width and height. The rectangle may have their corners rounded.

properties.name: height
properties.description:
Height defines the vertical length of the rectangle.

By default, the system automatically generates the shape height according to the base row height. You can set the height yourself by using the setter method. However, it cannot exceed the row height.

properties.name: rx
properties.description: rx defines the radius of the X-axis.

properties.name: ry
properties.description: ry defines the radius of the Y-axis.

properties.name: showTitle
properties.description: Flag to show or hide the title of the Rectangle.

properties.name: stroke
properties.description:
stroke property of the delta rectangle shape

Since: 1.135.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Title of the rectangle.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Width defines the horizontal length of the rectangle. Most of time it's calculated by properties time and endTime automatically

properties.name: x
properties.description: Defines the X-axis coordinate in the user coordinate system.

properties.name: y
properties.description: Defines the Y-axis coordinate in the user coordinate system.

symbols.title: class sap.gantt.simple.BaseRectangle

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape
symbols.description:
BaseShape is an abstract class. All other shapes must extend this class and provide implementation of method renderElement. It enables application developers to define it's own shapes.

This class provides the common used properties and methods.

properties.name: alignShape
properties.description: Enables alignment of the shape. The shape can be aligned to the top, middle or bottom. By default, this property is set to Middle. Note: Alignment is not possible for BaseLine and BasePath. It will be set to BaseChevron, BaseRectangle, BaseCursor BaseDiamond, BaseText, BaseTriangle and BaseGroup.

properties.name: animationSettings
properties.description:
animationSettings - A JSON object used to apply animation to the color of the specified shape.

  • "values": null - A list of values defining the sequence of colors appearing during animation.
  • "duration": "1s" - Denotes the duration of the animation. The value must be greater than 0, and can be expressed in hours(h), minutes(m), seconds(s), or milliseconds(ms).
  • "repeatCount": "indefinite" - Denotes the number of times an animation repeats.
Restriction: Enter at least two colors in the values key for the animation to work. If duration and repeatCount are unspecified, the default values (duration '1s' and repeatCount 'indefinite') are set. Note: This is only applicable for animation of shapes in Gantt charts. This is not applicable for utilization charts. Refer to an example below: 

{
	  "values": "sapContent_Selected_ForegroundColor;sapContent_ForegroundBorderColor",
	  "duration": "1s",
	  "repeatCount": "indefinite"
}


Since: 1.88.

properties.name: connectable
properties.description: Specifies whether the shape is connectable. When this property is set to true, you can connect two different shapes to create a relationship

properties.name: countInBirdEye
properties.description: Specifies whether or not the system takes this shape into account when performing a bird eye zooming. We suggest that you set this property to true only for shapes that really need to be considered into bird eye range.

properties.name: dragHighlightRows
properties.description:
Comma-separated value of row IDs for the rows that are highlighted when the shape is being dragged. The highlighted rows are the ones where the shape drop is allowed.

Since: 1.108.

properties.name: draggable
properties.description: Specifies whether the shape is draggable a draggble shape requires the shape is selectable set true as well.

properties.name: enableChainSelection
properties.description:
Enables selection of all shapes that are part of a shape chain in a Gantt chart

Since: 1.86.

properties.name: endTime
properties.description: End time of the shape. This property is mandatory if the shape is a duration shape. You must bind this property to a model, or set a valid JavaScript Date object. The duration is determined by minusing the value of property time

properties.name: expandable
properties.description: Whether the shape is expandable

properties.name: fill
properties.description:
The fill property enables you to define the fill color for shapes and texts.

For shapes and text the fill property is a presentation attribute that lets define the color (or any SVG paint servers like gradients or patterns)

properties.name: fillOpacity
properties.description: The fillOpacity property is a presentation property defining the opacity of the paint server (color, gradient, pattern, etc) applied to a shape.

properties.name: filter
properties.description: The filter property defines the filter effects defined by the element that shall be applied to its element

properties.name: fontFamily
properties.description:
This property indicates the font family that gets used to render the text in the shape.

Since: 1.94.

properties.name: fontSize
properties.description:
The fontSize property refers to the size of the font

Since: 1.100.

properties.name: fontWeight
properties.description:
The fontWeight property refers to the font weight that gets used to render the text in the shape.

Since: 1.100.

properties.name: highlightable
properties.description:
Whether the shape is highlightable

Since: 1.100.

properties.name: highlighted
properties.description:
Whether the shape is highlighted

Since: 1.100.

properties.name: horizontalTextAlignment
properties.description:
Horizontal alignment for the title of the Shape.

Since: 1.86.

properties.name: hoverable
properties.description: Specifies whether the shape is hoverable. hovering the mouse pointer over the shape fires the shapeMouseEnter event and moving the mouse pointer out of the shape fires the shapeMouseLeave event.

properties.name: leftAnchorPosition
properties.description:
Postion of left anchor for a shape to connect with other shapes whose value ranges from 0-100

Since: 1.131.

properties.name: opacity
properties.description:
The opacity attribute specifies the transparency of an object or of a group of objects, that is, the degree to which the background behind the element is overlaid.

The minimum value is 0.0 and maximum value is 1.0

properties.name: resizable
properties.description: Specifies whether the shape is resizable. Resizing a shape requires the shape is selectable as well.

properties.name: rightAnchorPosition
properties.description:
Postion of right anchor for a shape to connect with other shapes whose value ranges from 0-100

Since: 1.131.

properties.name: rowYCenter
properties.description: rowYCenter of the shape

properties.name: scheme
properties.description:
Scheme key of the shape.

The scheme is used by expand/collapse the main row shape. You can define the scheme together with shapeSchemes in sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable, the value defines here needse matchs the key value defines in sap.gantt.simple.ShapeScheme

properties.name: selectable
properties.description: Whether the shape is selectable

properties.name: selectableInChainSelection
properties.description:
Enables selection of a shape when it is part of the shape chain. By default, this property is set as True.

Since: 1.86.

properties.name: selected
properties.description: Whether the shape is selected

properties.name: selectedFill
properties.description:
The selectedFill property defines the color (or any SVG paint servers like gradients or patterns) of the shape when it is selected.

Since: 1.99.

properties.name: selectedTitleColor
properties.description:
The selectedTitleColor property defines the color (or any SVG paint servers like gradients or patterns) of the shape's title when it is selected.

Since: 1.99.

properties.name: shapeId
properties.description: ID of the shape. shapeId property represents a unique identifier for a business object. This property shall be bound to a property during initialization, it requires an unique non-empty value.

properties.name: showAnimation
properties.description:
Flag to show or hide animation of an active shape.

Since: 1.88.

properties.name: showTitle
properties.description: Flag to show or hide the title of the Shape.

properties.name: stroke
properties.description: The stroke property is a presentation property defining the color (or any SVG paint servers like gradients or patterns) used to paint the outline of the shape;

properties.name: strokeDasharray
properties.description: The strokeDasharray property is a presentation property defining the pattern of dashes and gaps used to paint the outline of the shape.

properties.name: strokeOpacity
properties.description: stroke opacity of the shape

properties.name: strokeWidth
properties.description: The strokeWidth property is a presentation property defining the width of the stroke to be applied to the shape.

properties.name: styleName
properties.description:
Provides the style class name for the shape that can be mapped from shapeStyles aggregation in GanttChartWithTable or GanttChartContainer.

Since: 1.130.

properties.name: time
properties.description: Start time of the shape. This property is mandatory. You must bind this property to a model, or set a valid JavaScript Date object. The value will be converted to x coordination when rendering. If not set, the shape is not visible.

properties.name: title
properties.description: The title of the Shape.

properties.name: titleColor
properties.description:
The titleColor property defines the color (or any SVG paint servers like gradients or patterns) of the shape title;

Since: 1.90.

properties.name: titleSpacing
properties.description:
The titleSpacing property defines the space between the start of the shape and the shape title in pixels

Since: 1.96.

properties.name: transform
properties.description: The transform property defines a list of transform definitions that are applied to an element and the element's children Right now in gantt library, only translate() method is supported. CSS methods like scale, skew, rotate and matrix doesn't support. And if you provide values for transform, the values will update xBias and yBias if translate the corresponding axis is matched.

properties.name: verticalTextAlignment
properties.description:
Vertical alignment for the title of the Shape.

Since: 1.86.

properties.name: visible
properties.description: Shows or hides the shape.

properties.name: xBias
properties.description: X offset in pixel. If the value is positive, in non-RTL mode, means to translate the visual object to the right in pixel unit. If the value is negative, the logic is inverted.

properties.name: yBias
properties.description: Y offset in pixel. If the value is positive, in non-RTL mode, it means translate the visual object to the bottom in pixel unit. If the value is negative, the logic is inverted.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Creates and initializes a new Shape class

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

methods.name: sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape.extend

returnValue.description: Created class / constructor function

parameters.name: sClassName
parameters.description: Name of the class being created

parameters.name: oClassInfo
parameters.description: Object literal with information about the class

parameters.name: FNMetaImpl
parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class

methods.description:
Creates a new subclass of class sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo.

oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in sap.ui.core.Element.extend.

methods.name: getAlignShape

returnValue.description: Value of property alignShape

methods.description:
Gets current value of property alignShape.

Enables alignment of the shape. The shape can be aligned to the top, middle or bottom. By default, this property is set to Middle. Note: Alignment is not possible for BaseLine and BasePath. It will be set to BaseChevron, BaseRectangle, BaseCursor BaseDiamond, BaseText, BaseTriangle and BaseGroup.

Default value is Middle.

methods.name: getAnimationSettings

returnValue.description: Value of property animationSettings

methods.description:
Gets current value of property animationSettings.

animationSettings - A JSON object used to apply animation to the color of the specified shape.

  • "values": null - A list of values defining the sequence of colors appearing during animation.
  • "duration": "1s" - Denotes the duration of the animation. The value must be greater than 0, and can be expressed in hours(h), minutes(m), seconds(s), or milliseconds(ms).
  • "repeatCount": "indefinite" - Denotes the number of times an animation repeats.
Restriction: Enter at least two colors in the values key for the animation to work. If duration and repeatCount are unspecified, the default values (duration '1s' and repeatCount 'indefinite') are set. Note: This is only applicable for animation of shapes in Gantt charts. This is not applicable for utilization charts. Refer to an example below: 

{
	  "values": "sapContent_Selected_ForegroundColor;sapContent_ForegroundBorderColor",
	  "duration": "1s",
	  "repeatCount": "indefinite"
}

methods.name: getAxisTime

returnValue.description: the AxisTime instance

methods.description:
Get an instance of AxisTime which belongs to current GanttChart. This is a shortcut method for all shape instances to convert timestamp to coordinates or vise verse

References:

  • sap.gantt.misc.AxisTime#timeToView
  • sap.gantt.misc.AxisTime#viewToTime

methods.name: getConnectable

returnValue.description: Value of property connectable

methods.description:
Gets current value of property connectable.

Specifies whether the shape is connectable. When this property is set to true, you can connect two different shapes to create a relationship

Default value is false.

methods.name: getCountInBirdEye

returnValue.description: Value of property countInBirdEye

methods.description:
Gets current value of property countInBirdEye.

Specifies whether or not the system takes this shape into account when performing a bird eye zooming. We suggest that you set this property to true only for shapes that really need to be considered into bird eye range.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getDraggable

returnValue.description: Value of property draggable

methods.description:
Gets current value of property draggable.

Specifies whether the shape is draggable a draggble shape requires the shape is selectable set true as well.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getDragHighlightRows

returnValue.description: Value of property dragHighlightRows

methods.description:
Gets current value of property dragHighlightRows.

Comma-separated value of row IDs for the rows that are highlighted when the shape is being dragged. The highlighted rows are the ones where the shape drop is allowed.

Default value is [].

methods.name: getEnableChainSelection

returnValue.description: Value of property enableChainSelection

methods.description:
Gets current value of property enableChainSelection.

Enables selection of all shapes that are part of a shape chain in a Gantt chart

Default value is false.

methods.name: getEndTime

returnValue.description: Value of property endTime

methods.description:
Gets current value of property endTime.

End time of the shape. This property is mandatory if the shape is a duration shape. You must bind this property to a model, or set a valid JavaScript Date object. The duration is determined by minusing the value of property time

methods.name: getExpandable

returnValue.description: Value of property expandable

methods.description:
Gets current value of property expandable.

Whether the shape is expandable

Default value is false.

methods.name: getFill

returnValue.description: Value of property fill

methods.description:
Gets current value of property fill.

The fill property enables you to define the fill color for shapes and texts.

For shapes and text the fill property is a presentation attribute that lets define the color (or any SVG paint servers like gradients or patterns)

methods.name: getFillOpacity

returnValue.description: Value of property fillOpacity

methods.description:
Gets current value of property fillOpacity.

The fillOpacity property is a presentation property defining the opacity of the paint server (color, gradient, pattern, etc) applied to a shape.

Default value is 1.0.

methods.name: getFilter

returnValue.description: Value of property filter

methods.description:
Gets current value of property filter.

The filter property defines the filter effects defined by the element that shall be applied to its element

methods.name: getFontFamily

returnValue.description: Value of property fontFamily

methods.description:
Gets current value of property fontFamily.

This property indicates the font family that gets used to render the text in the shape.

Default value is "sapFontFamily".

methods.name: getFontSize

returnValue.description: Value of property fontSize

methods.description:
Gets current value of property fontSize.

The fontSize property refers to the size of the font

Default value is 13.

methods.name: getFontWeight

returnValue.description: Value of property fontWeight

methods.description:
Gets current value of property fontWeight.

The fontWeight property refers to the font weight that gets used to render the text in the shape.

Default value is "normal".

methods.name: getHighlightable

returnValue.description: Value of property highlightable

methods.description:
Gets current value of property highlightable.

Whether the shape is highlightable

Default value is false.

methods.name: getHighlighted

returnValue.description: Value of property highlighted

methods.description:
Gets current value of property highlighted.

Whether the shape is highlighted

Default value is false.

methods.name: getHorizontalTextAlignment

returnValue.description: Value of property horizontalTextAlignment

methods.description:
Gets current value of property horizontalTextAlignment.

Horizontal alignment for the title of the Shape.

Default value is Start.

methods.name: getHoverable

returnValue.description: Value of property hoverable

methods.description:
Gets current value of property hoverable.

Specifies whether the shape is hoverable. hovering the mouse pointer over the shape fires the shapeMouseEnter event and moving the mouse pointer out of the shape fires the shapeMouseLeave event.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getLeftAnchorPosition

returnValue.description: Value of property leftAnchorPosition

methods.description:
Gets current value of property leftAnchorPosition.

Postion of left anchor for a shape to connect with other shapes whose value ranges from 0-100

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape.

methods.name: getOpacity

returnValue.description: Value of property opacity

methods.description:
Gets current value of property opacity.

The opacity attribute specifies the transparency of an object or of a group of objects, that is, the degree to which the background behind the element is overlaid.

The minimum value is 0.0 and maximum value is 1.0

Default value is 1.0.

methods.name: getResizable

returnValue.description: Value of property resizable

methods.description:
Gets current value of property resizable.

Specifies whether the shape is resizable. Resizing a shape requires the shape is selectable as well.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getRightAnchorPosition

returnValue.description: Value of property rightAnchorPosition

methods.description:

Postion of right anchor for a shape to connect with other shapes whose value ranges from 0-100

rowYCenter of the shape

methods.description:

Scheme key of the shape.

The scheme is used by expand/collapse the main row shape. You can define the scheme together with shapeSchemes in sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable, the value defines here needse matchs the key value defines in sap.gantt.simple.ShapeScheme

ID of the shape. shapeId property represents a unique identifier for a business object. This property shall be bound to a property during initialization, it requires an unique non-empty value.

methods.name: setAlignShape

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sAlignShape
parameters.description: New value for property alignShape

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property alignShape.

Enables alignment of the shape. The shape can be aligned to the top, middle or bottom. By default, this property is set to Middle. Note: Alignment is not possible for BaseLine and BasePath. It will be set to BaseChevron, BaseRectangle, BaseCursor BaseDiamond, BaseText, BaseTriangle and BaseGroup.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is Middle.

methods.name: setAnimationSettings

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oAnimationSettings
parameters.description: New value for property animationSettings

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property animationSettings.

animationSettings - A JSON object used to apply animation to the color of the specified shape.

  • "values": null - A list of values defining the sequence of colors appearing during animation.
  • "duration": "1s" - Denotes the duration of the animation. The value must be greater than 0, and can be expressed in hours(h), minutes(m), seconds(s), or milliseconds(ms).
  • "repeatCount": "indefinite" - Denotes the number of times an animation repeats.
Restriction: Enter at least two colors in the values key for the animation to work. If duration and repeatCount are unspecified, the default values (duration '1s' and repeatCount 'indefinite') are set. Note: This is only applicable for animation of shapes in Gantt charts. This is not applicable for utilization charts. Refer to an example below: 

{
	  "values": "sapContent_Selected_ForegroundColor;sapContent_ForegroundBorderColor",
	  "duration": "1s",
	  "repeatCount": "indefinite"
}

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property transform.

The transform property defines a list of transform definitions that are applied to an element and the element's children Right now in gantt library, only translate() method is supported. CSS methods like scale, skew, rotate and matrix doesn't support. And if you provide values for transform, the values will update xBias and yBias if translate the corresponding axis is matched.

X offset in pixel. If the value is positive, in non-RTL mode, means to translate the visual object to the right in pixel unit. If the value is negative, the logic is inverted.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is 0.

methods.name: getTruncateWidth

returnValue.description: Value of property truncateWidth.

methods.description:
Gets the value of property truncateWidth.

Truncating width. Default value -1 indicates truncating function is not activated. To enable truncating, specifies a truncate width. If text length exceeds truncate width, text is truncated automatically. This method will return the minimum between property truncateWidth and it's parent's width caculated by time range.

methods.name: getX

returnValue.description: Value of property x.

methods.description:
Gets current value of property x.

x coordinate of the bottom-left corner of the text.

Usually applications do not set this value. This getter carries out the calculation using property time from itself or it's parent that has method getTime. If you override the default value calculated by the getter, the alignment of the center is not guaranteed.

methods.name: getY

returnValue.description: Value of property y.

methods.description:
Gets current value of property y.

y coordinate of the bottom-left corner of the text.

Usually applications do not set this value. This getter carries out the calculation using parameter RowYCenter and property fontSize to align the center of the row rectangle along the y axis. If you override the default value calculated by the getter, the alignment of the center is not guaranteed.

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.connectorType
symbols.description:
Type connector shapes for relationship

This enum is part of the 'sap/gantt/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'simple.connectorType'.

properties.name: sap.gantt.simple.connectorType.HorizontalRectangle
properties.description: primarily used for overlapping of connector shapes.

symbols.title: enum sap.gantt.simple.connectorType

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.ContainerToolbar
symbols.description:
ContainerToolbar is be used with GanttChartContainer control. Use this control out of sap.gantt library is not supported.

It's defined as an aggregation of GanttChartContainer to provide actions to all sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable instances. By default, it only shows zooming controls and settings button. You can set properties to true to show more build-in buttons.

properties.name: alignCustomContentToRight
properties.description:
Defines how the toolbar custom content is aligned.
If set to true, the custom content in the toolbar is right-aligned. If set to false, it's left-aligned.
If a sap.gantt.simple.ContainerToolbarPlaceholder with a Spacer type is used in the content aggregation, the alignment of the content depends on this spacer.

properties.name: findMode
properties.description:
Defines where the search box should appear on pressing the find button

Since: 1.102.

properties.name: infoOfSelectItems
properties.description:
Array of plain objects that have "key" and "text" properties, or array of sap.ui.core.Item used to configure the items in the sap.m.Select control

This property is only works if the zoomControlType is Select

properties.name: showBirdEyeButton
properties.description: Flag to show or hide bird eye button on the toolbar

properties.name: showDisplayTypeButton
properties.description: Flag to show or hide display type menu on the toolbar

properties.name: showLegendButton
properties.description: Flag to show or hide legend button

constructor.description:
Creates and initializes a new ContainerToolbar class

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

methods.name: getAlignCustomContentToRight

returnValue.description: Value of property alignCustomContentToRight

methods.description:
Gets current value of property alignCustomContentToRight.

Defines how the toolbar custom content is aligned.
If set to true, the custom content in the toolbar is right-aligned. If set to false, it's left-aligned.
If a sap.gantt.simple.ContainerToolbarPlaceholder with a Spacer type is used in the content aggregation, the alignment of the content depends on this spacer.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getFindMode

returnValue.description: Value of property findMode

methods.description:
Gets current value of property findMode.

Defines where the search box should appear on pressing the find button

Default value is Both.

methods.name: getInfoOfSelectItems

returnValue.description: Value of property infoOfSelectItems

methods.description:
Gets current value of property infoOfSelectItems.

Array of plain objects that have "key" and "text" properties, or array of sap.ui.core.Item used to configure the items in the sap.m.Select control

This property is only works if the zoomControlType is Select

Default value is [].

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.DimensionLegend
symbols.description:
Dimension Legend provides a template for two-dimension legends. This template defines the representation (shape, pattern, and color) of individual legend items and their corresponding meanings in both dimensions.

Consider that you need to create a legend where legend items represent both the type and status of an object. In this case, you can configure column to indicate object statuses and row to indicate object types. Assume that valid object types are "Freight Order", "Freight Unit", and "Trailer Unit"; valid object statuses are "Executed", "In Execution", "Fixed", "Planned", and Unplanned. You will have a three by four two-dimension legend containing twelve legend items. Each them represents an object in a specific type and a specific status. For example, a red square stands for executed freight orders.

properties.description:
Defines how the Gantt chart is displayed.

  • If set to Both, both the table and the chart are displayed.
  • If set to Chart, only the chart is displayed.
  • If set to Table, only the table is displayed.
This property overrides the displayType properties of individual Gantt charts included in the ganttCharts aggregation.

properties.name: enableAdhocLine
properties.description:
Flag to enable and disable adhoc lines representing milestones and events along the time axis.

When this value is set, it overrides the corresponding value on instances of aggregation ganttCharts.

properties.name: enableAutoFocusOnZoom
properties.description:
This property enables auto focus while zooming in on a selected shape.

Since: 1.126.

properties.name: enableAutoSelectOnFind
properties.description:
This property enables the auto selection of a shape upon search and find.

Since: 1.111.

properties.name: enableCursorLine
properties.description:
Flag to enable and disable the cursor line that follows the cursor.

When this value is set, it overrides the corresponding value on instances of aggregation ganttCharts.

properties.name: enableDeltaLine
properties.description:
Flag to enable and disable delta lines

When this value is set, it overrides the corresponding value on instances of aggregation ganttCharts.

Since: 1.84.

properties.name: enableNonWorkingTime
properties.description:
Flag to enable and disable non-working time

When this value is set, it overrides the corresponding value on instances of aggregation ganttCharts.

Since: 1.86.

properties.name: enableNowLine
properties.description:
Flag to enable and disable the present time indicator.

When this value is set, it overrides the corresponding value on instances of aggregation ganttCharts.

properties.name: enableStatusBar
properties.description:
Flag to enable and disable status bar.

Since: 1.88.

properties.name: enableTimeScrollSync
properties.description: Flag to enable and disable scroll synchronization by time on instances of aggregation ganttCharts.

properties.name: enableVariantManagement
properties.description:
Property to enable variant management

Since: 1.95.

properties.name: enableVerticalLine
properties.description:
Flag to enable and disable vertical lines representing intervals along the time axis.

When this value is set, it overrides the corresponding value on instances of aggregation ganttCharts.

properties.name: height
properties.description:
height of the container.

Note that when a percentage is given, for the height to work as expected, the height of the surrounding container must be defined.

properties.name: hideSettingsItem
properties.description:
Defines the list of items to be hidden in Settings.

Since: 1.88.

properties.name: layoutOrientation
properties.description: The GanttChartContainer use Splitter to manager the layout, it can have horizontal or vertical orientation. Note: the property only take effect if GanttChartContainer has more than 1 ganttChart instances

properties.name: showSearchSidePanel
properties.description:
Flag to enable and disable search side panel.

Since: 1.100.

properties.name: statusBarDatePattern
properties.description:
Determines the date pattern set on the status bar.

Since: 1.88.

properties.name: statusBarTimePattern
properties.description:
Determines the time pattern set on the status bar.

Since: 1.88.

properties.name: statusMessage
properties.description:
Defines the message texts set on the status bar.

Since: 1.88.

properties.name: width
properties.description:
width of the container.

Note that when a percentage is given, for the width to work as expected, the width of the surrounding container must be defined.

aggregations.name: searchSidePanel
aggregations.description:
Side panel to display search results of Find and Select operation in the chart area

Since: 1.100.

aggregations.name: searchSidePanelList
aggregations.description:
List of search results displayed on the side panel of Find and Select operation

Since: 1.102.

aggregations.name: shapeStyles
aggregations.description:
Configuration for the Gantt chart styles. This aggregation will be ignored if ganntStyleConfigs aggregation is set for ganttChartWithTable.

Since: 1.130.

aggregations.name: sidePanel
aggregations.description:
Side panel to place custom control within the Gantt Chart Container.

Since: 1.126.

aggregations.name: svgDefs
aggregations.description: Definitions of paint servers used for advanced shape features around SVG fill, stroke, and filter attributes. The generated SVG will be reused in all gantt chart instances

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Creates and initializes a new Gantt chart container.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: customGanttSearchResult

parameters.name: searchResults
parameters.description: Array of search results that the application can use to filter results shown on the toolbar and side panel

events.description:
The event is fired when the search results are being populated.

This event enables the application to filter the search results that are shown on the toolbar and side panel

Since: 1.106.

events.name: customSettingChange

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the custom setting

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value of the custom setting

events.description:
Event fired when the custom settings value is changed.

The custom settings are application provided settings that can be configured in the settings dialog. This event allows the application to handle these settings. Only check boxes are supported.

events.name: ganttSearchSidePanelList

parameters.name: searchResults
parameters.description: Array of search results with each result containing data which application can use to customise side panel search list.

events.description:
The event is fired when the list inside search side panel is being populated.

This event enables the application to modify the list (i.e, change text, add icons, etc) which is shown on the search side panel.

Since: 1.102.

events.name: searchSelectionChanged
events.description:
The event is fired when the search result selection changes.

This event enables the application to react when a change occurs in the selected search item.

Since: 1.121.

events.name: variantApplied
events.description:
The event is triggered when a variant is applied. Note that all changes are saved before the variant is applied.

This event enables the application to update binding parameters of tables, and also updates the charts, if required, after applying the changes.

Since: 1.88.

Default value is Both.
