symbols.title: class sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartContainer

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable
symbols.description: The Gantt Chart control provides a comprehensive set of features to display hierarchical data and visualized shapes together. It's designed to fully support OData binding, declaring hierarchical data and shapes bindings in XML view. It's the recommended control for new applications.

properties.name: _isAppRunningInRTA
properties.description:
Flag to indicate if the app is running in Runtime Adaptation (RTA) mode.

Since: 1.91.

properties.name: adhocLineLayer
properties.description: Specifies on which layer adhoc lines reside. By default, adhoc lines are on top of all other shapes and patterns.

properties.name: datePattern
properties.description:
Specifies how the application's date is displayed in the gantt chart. For example: "dd.MM.yyyy" (31.01.2018)

Since: 1.86.

properties.name: deltaAreaHighlightColor
properties.description:
Property to add custom color to the highlighted area between delta lines. This would default to Fiori standard color

Since: 1.86.

properties.name: deltaLineLayer
properties.description:
Specifies the layer on which Delta Lines reside. By default, Delta Lines are above all shapes and patterns.

Since: 1.84.

properties.name: disableShapeDoubleClickEvent
properties.description: Disables or enables the shapeDoubleClick event. If set to true, the shapeDoubleClick event is disabled.

properties.name: displayType
properties.description:
Defines how the Gantt chart is displayed.

  • If set to Both, both the table and the chart are displayed.
  • If set to Chart, only the chart is displayed.
  • If set to Table, only the table is displayed.
When the parent element of the Gantt chart is the sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartContainer, this property overrides the displayType property of sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartContainer.

properties.name: dragOrientation
properties.description:
Drag orientation of Gantt Chart.

This property doesn't limit the mouse cursor position but the dragging ghost position when dragging it around. This property has 3 values:

  • Free: The dragging ghost moves along with your mouse cursor.
  • Horizontal: The dragged ghost only moves horizontally, cross row dragging is restricted. You can use this mode if you only need to change the times of the dragging shape
  • Vertical: Notice Vertical works if only one shape is selected (regardless shapeSelectionMode), it's showing forbidden cursor style on multiple shape selections when you are dragging. You can use this vertical mode if you only want to change the assignment without changing shape times.

properties.name: enableAdhocLine
properties.description: Flag to show or hide adhoc lines representing milestones and events along the time axis

properties.name: enableChartDeltaAreaHighlight
properties.description:
Flag to show or hide Chart Delta Area highlighting

Since: 1.84.

properties.name: enableChartHoverState
properties.description:
Option to disable or enable the chart row's hover state.

Since: 1.93.

properties.name: enableChartOverflowToolbar
properties.description:
Option to show or hide the chart overflow toolbar.

Since: 1.92.

properties.name: enableChartSelectionState
properties.description:
Option to disable or enable the chart row's selection state.

Since: 1.93.

properties.name: enableCursorLine
properties.description: Flag whether to show or hide the cursor line when moving your mouse cursor

properties.name: enableDeltaLine
properties.description:
Flag to show or hide Delta Lines

Since: 1.84.

properties.name: enableExpandedRowBackground
properties.description:
Property to enable the background color for expanded rows. By default, this would show the row background

Since: 1.84.

properties.name: enableExpandedRowBorders
properties.description:
Property to enable borders for expanded rows. By default, only row borders are enabled.

Since: 1.84.

properties.name: enableLassoInvert
properties.description: Enables inversion on shape selection while drawing lasso

properties.name: enableMultipleGhosts
properties.description:
Flag to enable displaying multiple ghosts when multiple shapes are selected and dragged.

Since: 1.127.

properties.name: enableNonWorkingTime
properties.description:
Flag to show or hide non-working time

Since: 1.86.

properties.name: enableNowLine
properties.description: Flag whether to show or hide the present time indicator.

properties.name: enablePseudoShapes
properties.description:
Optimizes the rendering of overlapping shapes

Since: 1.110.

properties.name: enableSelectAndDrag
properties.description:
Allows to drag, drop, and resize a shape on explicitly selecting the shape.

Since: 1.85.

properties.name: enableVerticalLine
properties.description: Flag to show or hide vertical lines representing intervals along the time axis

properties.name: expandedRowHeight
properties.description: Property to define the height of an expanded row in pixels. * @since 1.85

properties.name: findBy
properties.description:
Defines the property names for which findAll method should search in different entities

Since: 1.100.

properties.name: findByOperator
properties.description:
Defines relationship between the operator and the property names using the findAll method

Since: 1.100.

properties.name: ghostAlignment
properties.description: The dragging ghost alignment of Gantt Chart. This property define the visual effect of ghost position on dragging, it also effect the parameter value in event shapeDragEnd

properties.name: height
properties.description: Height of the control.

properties.name: horizontalLazyLoadingEnabled
properties.description:
Set to true if Gantt chart is configured to be lazy loaded horizontally. Application should fetch the data only for the visible horizon. Application also should make sure to fetch the relevant data on user interactions like horizontal scroll, zoom out, bird eye which changes the visible horizon until the time when all the data is fetched. This property has to be used with setAllDataLoadedPromise().

Since: 1.109.

properties.name: isConnectorDetailsVisible
properties.description:
Defines whether shapeConnectorList is displayed upon the click of connector/relationship or not

Since: 1.102.

properties.name: nowLineInUTC
properties.description:
Flag whether to show the nowLine in UTC or in FLP time.

Since: 1.68.

properties.name: optimiseRelationships
properties.description:
Configuration that optimizes relationship rendering behaviour by avoiding the rendering of non-interactive relationships. When the flag is enabled, a relationship instance is required in both the predecessor and successor rows, where the shapeTypeStart, and shapeTypeEnd property of relationship are set to default.

Since: 1.133.

properties.name: printingBatchSize
properties.description:
Defines the batch size, that is the number of rows, to be printed per iteration. If set to 0, batching is disabled and the entire Gantt chart is printed. This could slow the performance and make the browser non-responsive. Note: Relationship lines can be interrupted if the start and end points are in different canvases. To minimize this effect, choose a bigger batch size, ensuring that the browser is responsive during printing.

Since: 1.90.

properties.name: relationshipShapeSize
properties.description:
Specifies the size of the relationship's shape. Applicable to triangles, square, diamond, and circle shapes; excluding horizontal rectangle and vertical rectangle shapes.

Since: 1.96.

properties.name: rowHighlightAndHoverFill
properties.description:
The rowHighlightAndHoverFill property defines the color that is filled for the highlighted and hovered rows when a shape is being dragged The highlighted rows are the ones where the shape drop is allowed

Since: 1.108.

properties.name: rowHighlightFill
properties.description:
The rowHighlightFill property defines the color that is filled for the highlighted rows when a shape is being dragged The highlighted rows are the ones where the shape drop is allowed

Since: 1.108.

properties.name: selectOnlyGraphicalShape
properties.description:
Enables selection of only graphical shapes excluding labels.

Since: 1.93.

properties.name: selectionPanelSize
properties.description:
The width of selection panel.

In sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable, the selectionPanelSize is the Table/TreeTable width in the embedded Splitter.

properties.name: shapeHighlightSettings
properties.description:
A JSON object containing the shapeHighlightSettings that is used to configure shape highlight styles. If nothing is specified, then the default highlight styles (2px dashed black border) is set. Below you can find a brief example 


{
   color: "@sapChart_Sequence_9_Plus2",
   strokeWidth: 2,
   strokeDasharray: "5,1"
   shapeColor: null,
   fillOpacity: 0
}


Since: 1.100.

properties.name: shapeMouseEnterDelay
properties.description:
Time in milliseconds where the mouse has to be on the same shape for the specified time before triggering the shapeMouseEnter event

Since: 1.112.

properties.name: shapeMouseLeaveDelay
properties.description:
Time in milliseconds where the mouse has moved out of the hovered shape for the specified time before triggering the shapeMouseLeave event

Since: 1.112.

properties.name: shapeOverRelationship
properties.description:
Specifies whether shape is rendered over relationship or relationship over shape when relationship leads through shape.

If enabled, shapes are rendered over relationships. If disabled, relationships are rendered over shapes.

Since: 1.76.

properties.name: shapeRenderOrder
properties.description:
Comma-separated value of shape aggregations to decide the rendering order The aggregations first in the array are rendered first. Aggregations not mentioned in the array will be rendered at the very first Example: "shapes3,shapes2,shapes1" means shapes3 will be rendered at the bottom, and shapes1 will be rendered at the top

Since: 1.113.

properties.name: shapeSelectionMode
properties.description:
Shape selection mode of the Gantt Chart. This property controls whether single or multiple shapes can be selected. When the selection mode is changed, the current selection is removed.

The shapeSelectionMode only works if selectable property on the defined Shape is set to true.

properties.name: shapeSelectionSettings
properties.description:
A JSON object containing the shapeSelectionSettings which will be used to configure shape selection styles. If nothing is specified, then the default selection styles (2px dashed red border) is set. New properties 'shapeColor' and 'fillOpacity' are introduced as of SAPUI5 1.85 release. Using these, you can configure color and opacity of highlighted shapes in a gantt chart. Below you can find a brief example 


{
   color: "@sapChart_Sequence_9_Plus2",
   strokeWidth: 2,
   strokeDasharray: "5,1"
   shapeColor: null,
   fillOpacity: 0
}

properties.name: showExportTableToExcel
properties.description:
Flag to show or hide the Export Button for a Table. Note:CustomData - Mandatory field for Export table to Excel functionality. It contains properties that can be configured based on the column configuration, where the key name is restricted to exportTableColumnConfig. The custom data is created for aggregation of columns in a table. Export to excel feature is supported for both OData and JSON models, with a restriction that the tree structure converts to a flat array for a JSON model. The fields supported in the custom data are:

  • leadingProperty - DataSource field for a column. This is a mandatory field.
  • columnKey - Identifier for individual columns.
  • dataType - Data type for the given column element. The supported data types are dateTime, stringDate, date, time, boolean, string and numeric.
  • isCurrency - Boolean value to determine if the column type contains Currency.
  • unit - Text to display as the unit of measurement of a numeric value.
  • unitProperty - Name of the DataSource field that contains the unit/currency texts.
  • scale - Number of digits after the decimal point of numeric values.
  • precision - Precision for numeric values.
  • displayFormat - Date format to be displayed. The default for dateTime is DD-MM-YY HH:MM, and the default for date is DD-MM-YY.
  • hierarchyNodeLevel - DataSource field which contains the hierarchy level. This is currently supported only for OData models.
  • wrap - Boolean value to determine whether the contents of the table should be wrapped.
Example: 
	
		<Column sortProperty="ObjectName" filterProperty="ObjectName">
			<customData>
				<core:CustomData key="exportTableColumnConfig"
					value='{"columnKey": "ObjectName",
	 				"leadingProperty":"ObjectName",
					"dataType": "string",
					"hierarchyNodeLevel": "HierarchyNodeLevel",
					"wrap": true}' />
			</customData>
			<m:Text text="Object Name"/>
			<template>
				<m:Label text="{data>ObjectName}"/>
			</template>
		</Column>

properties.name: showGanttHeader
properties.description:
Option to show or hide the header of the Gantt chart

Since: 1.90.

properties.name: showParentRowOnExpand
properties.description:
Option to show or hide the parent row on expand. This is applicable only for multi-activity row settings.

Since: 1.86.

properties.name: showShapeTimeOnDrag
properties.description: Flag to show or hide the start time and end time of a shape when you drag it along the time line. The property takes effect if only one shape is selected or enableMultipleGhosts is set to false.

properties.name: showTextOnGhost
properties.description:
Option to show or hide shape labels on ghost while dragging. The property takes effect only when enableMultipleGhosts is set to true.

Since: 1.94.

properties.name: snapMode
properties.description:
Enables snapping of shapes to attach to the nearest visual element while dragging.

Since: 1.91.

properties.name: snapTimeInterval
properties.description:
Defines the least time taken in seconds for a shape to snap while in a particular zoom level. eg. { "4hour":{timeInterval:1800}, ---> 30mins Snap "1hour":{timeInterval:900} ---> 15mins Snap }

Since: 1.91.

properties.name: timePattern
properties.description:
Specifies how the application's time is displayed in the gantt chart. For example: "hh:mm a" (12:05 PM)

Since: 1.86.

properties.name: useParentShapeOnExpand
properties.description:
Determines if only tasks need to be used for rendering the expanded shapes. Subtasks are not required.

Since: 1.98.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Width of the control.

aggregations.name: _pseudoSvgDefs
aggregations.description: SVG reusable element definitions for pseudo shapes.

aggregations.name: _splitter
aggregations.description: private aggregation for resizing the selection panel

aggregations.name: adhocLines
aggregations.description: The aggregation is used to store configuration of adhoc lines, adhoc lines represent milestones and events in axis time.

deprecated.text: use {@link sap.gantt.simple.AdhocLine} instead.

aggregations.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.84. use sap.gantt.simple.AdhocLine instead.

aggregations.name: axisTimeStrategy
aggregations.description: This aggregation controls the zoom strategies and zoom rate in Gantt Chart.

aggregations.name: calendarDef
aggregations.description:
Paint servers consumed by special shape sap.gantt.shape.cal.Calendar.

This aggregation is designed to improve performance of calendar shapes. Rows usually share a similar definition with calendar shapes. It is possible to define a Calendar paint server to draw only one rectangle for each row. Notes for classes extended from sap.gantt.def.cal.CalendarDef: Different from property paintServerDefs, paint servers defined here must implement method getDefNode() instead of method getDefString().

aggregations.name: deltaLines
aggregations.description:
The aggregation is used to store configuration of Delta Lines

Since: 1.84.

aggregations.name: ganttAdaptationData
aggregations.description:
Specifies a data structure with arbitrary key value pairs to support customization of Gantt charts with tables.

Since: 1.90.

aggregations.name: locale
aggregations.description:
Configuration of locale settings.

Most locale settings can be configured in sap.ui.configuration objects. Only the time zone and day-light-saving time options are provided by locale settings. We recommend that you set the type of this argument to sap.gantt.config.Locale. Otherwise some properties you set may not function properly.

aggregations.name: overflowToolbarItems
aggregations.description:
Items can be added in chart overflow toolbar using this aggregation.

Since: 1.102.

aggregations.name: shapeSchemes
aggregations.description:
Shape schemes of Gantt Chart.

Defines all the possible shape schemes in the Gantt chart control. Note:If you don't use expand chart, you can omit this aggregations. If not set, a default sap.gantt.simple.ShapeScheme is provided automatically.

aggregations.name: shapeStyles
aggregations.description:
Configuration for the Gantt chart styles. This Aggregation will override shapeStyles aggregation of ganttChartContainer.

Since: 1.130.

aggregations.name: simpleAdhocLines
aggregations.description:
The aggregation is used to store configuration of adhoc lines, adhoc lines represent milestones and events in axis time.

Since: 1.84.

aggregations.name: svgDefs
aggregations.description:
SVG reusable element definitions.

If this property is provided, the paint server definition of the SVG is rendered. Method getDefString() should be implemented by all paint server classes that are passed in in this property. We recommend that you set the type of this argument to sap.gantt.def.SvgDefs. Otherwise some properties you set may not function properly.

aggregations.name: table
aggregations.description:
Table of the Gantt Chart

You can use {sap.ui.table.Table} if you have a flat list data or {sap.ui.table.TreeTable} if you have hierarchical data.

         "endTime": date2,
    },
    "shapeUid2": {
         "time": date3,
         "endTime": date4,
    },
}

It's impossible to get all selected shape instances because of scrolling might destroy shapes on the invisible rows

parameters.name: lastDraggedShapeUid
parameters.description: The last dragged shape

parameters.name: targetRow
parameters.description: The target row of gantt chart. No source row because of user might drag multiple shapes on different rows.

parameters.name: cursorDateTime
parameters.description: Represent the cursor date & time when drop event fired

parameters.name: newDateTime
parameters.description:
The startTime or endTime of a dropped shape. In Free or Horizontal drag orientation, the value depends on the ghost alignment:

  • Start: newDateTime is the shape new start time, newDateTime is equal with cursorDateTime
  • None: newDateTime is the shape new start time
  • End: newDateTime is the shape new end time, newDateTime is equal with cursorDateTime

In Veritcal drag orientation, newDateTime is the shape new start time, and not equal with cursorDateTime in usual.

parameters.name: targetShape
parameters.description: Represents the shape which the dragged shape dropped on.

events.description: Event fired when a drag-and-drop occurs on one or more selected shapes.

Fired when the shape's highlight has been changed

parameters.name: pageX

parameters.name: pageY

parameters.name: isPinConnector

events.name: visibleHorizonUpdate

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Specifies how the update was initiated.

parameters.name: subType
parameters.description:
Provides subType information about the type.

Since: 1.100.

parameters.name: lastVisibleHorizon
parameters.description: Value of the visible horizon before the current update. Some types of this event don't have this value.

parameters.name: currentVisibleHorizon
parameters.description: Value of the visible horizon after the current update.

parameters.name: lastRenderedVisibleHorizon
parameters.description:
Value of the visible horizon with buffer before the current update.

Since: 1.102.

parameters.name: currentRenderedVisibleHorizon
parameters.description:
Value of the visible horizon with buffer after the current update.

Since: 1.102.

events.description:
This event is fired when the visible horizon is changed.

Since: 1.68.

parameters.name: newDateTime
parameters.description:
The startTime or endTime of a dropped shape. In Free or Horizontal drag orientation, the value depends on the ghost alignment:

  • Start: newDateTime is the shape new start time, newDateTime is equal with cursorDateTime
  • None: newDateTime is the shape new start time
  • End: newDateTime is the shape new end time, newDateTime is equal with cursorDateTime

In Veritcal drag orientation, newDateTime is the shape new start time, and not equal with cursorDateTime in usual.

methods.name: getCalendarDef
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation calendarDef.

Paint servers consumed by special shape sap.gantt.shape.cal.Calendar.

This aggregation is designed to improve performance of calendar shapes. Rows usually share a similar definition with calendar shapes. It is possible to define a Calendar paint server to draw only one rectangle for each row. Notes for classes extended from sap.gantt.def.cal.CalendarDef: Different from property paintServerDefs, paint servers defined here must implement method getDefNode() instead of method getDefString().

methods.name: getDisplayType

returnValue.description: Value of property displayType

methods.description:
Gets current value of property displayType.

Defines how the Gantt chart is displayed.

  • If set to Both, both the table and the chart are displayed.
  • If set to Chart, only the chart is displayed.
  • If set to Table, only the table is displayed.
When the parent element of the Gantt chart is the sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartContainer, this property overrides the displayType property of sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartContainer.

Default value is Both.

methods.name: getDragOrientation

returnValue.description: Value of property dragOrientation

methods.description:
Gets current value of property dragOrientation.

Drag orientation of Gantt Chart.

This property doesn't limit the mouse cursor position but the dragging ghost position when dragging it around. This property has 3 values:

  • Free: The dragging ghost moves along with your mouse cursor.
  • Horizontal: The dragged ghost only moves horizontally, cross row dragging is restricted. You can use this mode if you only need to change the times of the dragging shape
  • Vertical: Notice Vertical works if only one shape is selected (regardless shapeSelectionMode), it's showing forbidden cursor style on multiple shape selections when you are dragging. You can use this vertical mode if you only want to change the assignment without changing shape times.

Default value is Free.

returnValue.description: Value of property optimiseRelationships

methods.description:
Gets current value of property optimiseRelationships.

Configuration that optimizes relationship rendering behaviour by avoiding the rendering of non-interactive relationships. When the flag is enabled, a relationship instance is required in both the predecessor and successor rows, where the shapeTypeStart, and shapeTypeEnd property of relationship are set to default.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getPrintingBatchSize

returnValue.description: Value of property printingBatchSize

methods.description:
Gets current value of property printingBatchSize.

Defines the batch size, that is the number of rows, to be printed per iteration. If set to 0, batching is disabled and the entire Gantt chart is printed. This could slow the performance and make the browser non-responsive. Note: Relationship lines can be interrupted if the start and end points are in different canvases. To minimize this effect, choose a bigger batch size, ensuring that the browser is responsive during printing.

Default value is 100.

methods.description:

Specifies whether shape is rendered over relationship or relationship over shape when relationship leads through shape.

If enabled, shapes are rendered over relationships. If disabled, relationships are rendered over shapes.

Default value is true.

methods.name: getShapeRenderOrder

returnValue.description: Value of property shapeRenderOrder

methods.description:
Gets current value of property shapeRenderOrder.

Comma-separated value of shape aggregations to decide the rendering order The aggregations first in the array are rendered first. Aggregations not mentioned in the array will be rendered at the very first Example: "shapes3,shapes2,shapes1" means shapes3 will be rendered at the bottom, and shapes1 will be rendered at the top

Default value is [].

methods.name: getShapeSchemes
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation shapeSchemes.

Defines all the possible shape schemes in the Gantt chart control. Note:If you don't use expand chart, you can omit this aggregations. If not set, a default sap.gantt.simple.ShapeScheme is provided automatically.

methods.name: getShapeSelectionMode

returnValue.description: Value of property shapeSelectionMode

methods.description:
Gets current value of property shapeSelectionMode.

Shape selection mode of the Gantt Chart. This property controls whether single or multiple shapes can be selected. When the selection mode is changed, the current selection is removed.

The shapeSelectionMode only works if selectable property on the defined Shape is set to true.

Default value is MultiWithKeyboard.

methods.name: getShapeSelectionSettings

methods.description:
Gets current value of property shapeSelectionSettings.

A JSON object containing the shapeSelectionSettings which will be used to configure shape selection styles. If nothing is specified, then the default selection styles (2px dashed red border) is set. New properties 'shapeColor' and 'fillOpacity' are introduced as of SAPUI5 1.85 release. Using these, you can configure color and opacity of highlighted shapes in a gantt chart. Below you can find a brief example 


{
   color: "@sapChart_Sequence_9_Plus2",
   strokeWidth: 2,
   strokeDasharray: "5,1"
   shapeColor: null,
   fillOpacity: 0
}

methods.name: getShowExportTableToExcel

returnValue.description: Value of property showExportTableToExcel

methods.description:
Gets current value of property showExportTableToExcel.

Flag to show or hide the Export Button for a Table. Note:CustomData - Mandatory field for Export table to Excel functionality. It contains properties that can be configured based on the column configuration, where the key name is restricted to exportTableColumnConfig. The custom data is created for aggregation of columns in a table. Export to excel feature is supported for both OData and JSON models, with a restriction that the tree structure converts to a flat array for a JSON model. The fields supported in the custom data are:

  • leadingProperty - DataSource field for a column. This is a mandatory field.
  • columnKey - Identifier for individual columns.
  • dataType - Data type for the given column element. The supported data types are dateTime, stringDate, date, time, boolean, string and numeric.
  • isCurrency - Boolean value to determine if the column type contains Currency.
  • unit - Text to display as the unit of measurement of a numeric value.
  • unitProperty - Name of the DataSource field that contains the unit/currency texts.
  • scale - Number of digits after the decimal point of numeric values.
  • precision - Precision for numeric values.
  • displayFormat - Date format to be displayed. The default for dateTime is DD-MM-YY HH:MM, and the default for date is DD-MM-YY.
  • hierarchyNodeLevel - DataSource field which contains the hierarchy level. This is currently supported only for OData models.
  • wrap - Boolean value to determine whether the contents of the table should be wrapped.
Example: 
	
		<Column sortProperty="ObjectName" filterProperty="ObjectName">
			<customData>
				<core:CustomData key="exportTableColumnConfig"
					value='{"columnKey": "ObjectName",
	 				"leadingProperty":"ObjectName",
					"dataType": "string",
					"hierarchyNodeLevel": "HierarchyNodeLevel",
					"wrap": true}' />
			</customData>
			<m:Text text="Object Name"/>
			<template>
				<m:Label text="{data>ObjectName}"/>
			</template>
		</Column>

Default value is false.

methods.name: setDisplayType

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sDisplayType
parameters.description: New value for property displayType

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property displayType.

Defines how the Gantt chart is displayed.

  • If set to Both, both the table and the chart are displayed.
  • If set to Chart, only the chart is displayed.
  • If set to Table, only the table is displayed.
When the parent element of the Gantt chart is the sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartContainer, this property overrides the displayType property of sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartContainer.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is Both.

methods.name: setDragOrientation

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sDragOrientation
parameters.description: New value for property dragOrientation

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property dragOrientation.

Drag orientation of Gantt Chart.

This property doesn't limit the mouse cursor position but the dragging ghost position when dragging it around. This property has 3 values:

  • Free: The dragging ghost moves along with your mouse cursor.
  • Horizontal: The dragged ghost only moves horizontally, cross row dragging is restricted. You can use this mode if you only need to change the times of the dragging shape
  • Vertical: Notice Vertical works if only one shape is selected (regardless shapeSelectionMode), it's showing forbidden cursor style on multiple shape selections when you are dragging. You can use this vertical mode if you only want to change the assignment without changing shape times.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is Free.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: iPrintingBatchSize
parameters.description: New value for property printingBatchSize

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property printingBatchSize.

Defines the batch size, that is the number of rows, to be printed per iteration. If set to 0, batching is disabled and the entire Gantt chart is printed. This could slow the performance and make the browser non-responsive. Note: Relationship lines can be interrupted if the start and end points are in different canvases. To minimize this effect, choose a bigger batch size, ensuring that the browser is responsive during printing.

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is 100.

methods.name: setShowExportTableToExcel

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bShowExportTableToExcel
parameters.description: New value for property showExportTableToExcel

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property showExportTableToExcel.

Flag to show or hide the Export Button for a Table. Note:CustomData - Mandatory field for Export table to Excel functionality. It contains properties that can be configured based on the column configuration, where the key name is restricted to exportTableColumnConfig. The custom data is created for aggregation of columns in a table. Export to excel feature is supported for both OData and JSON models, with a restriction that the tree structure converts to a flat array for a JSON model. The fields supported in the custom data are:

  • leadingProperty - DataSource field for a column. This is a mandatory field.
  • columnKey - Identifier for individual columns.
  • dataType - Data type for the given column element. The supported data types are dateTime, stringDate, date, time, boolean, string and numeric.
  • isCurrency - Boolean value to determine if the column type contains Currency.
  • unit - Text to display as the unit of measurement of a numeric value.
  • unitProperty - Name of the DataSource field that contains the unit/currency texts.
  • scale - Number of digits after the decimal point of numeric values.
  • precision - Precision for numeric values.
  • displayFormat - Date format to be displayed. The default for dateTime is DD-MM-YY HH:MM, and the default for date is DD-MM-YY.
  • hierarchyNodeLevel - DataSource field which contains the hierarchy level. This is currently supported only for OData models.
  • wrap - Boolean value to determine whether the contents of the table should be wrapped.
Example: 
	
		<Column sortProperty="ObjectName" filterProperty="ObjectName">
			<customData>
				<core:CustomData key="exportTableColumnConfig"
					value='{"columnKey": "ObjectName",
	 				"leadingProperty":"ObjectName",
					"dataType": "string",
					"hierarchyNodeLevel": "HierarchyNodeLevel",
					"wrap": true}' />
			</customData>
			<m:Text text="Object Name"/>
			<template>
				<m:Label text="{data>ObjectName}"/>
			</template>
		</Column>

When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored.

Default value is false.

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.GanttPrinting
symbols.description:
The GanttPrinting control enables you to export your Gantt chart as a PDF document.
Please note that the quality of the exported image in PDF is currently limited to a pixel density of 96 PPI and the area of the chart that can be exported is limited to a canvas area of 16,384 x 16,384 pixels (268,435,456 square pixels).

associations.name: ganttChart
associations.description: Gantt chart to be exported as PDF document.

Constructor for a new GanttPrinting control.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

Creates a new subclass of class sap.gantt.simple.GanttRowSettings with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo.

oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in sap.ui.table.RowSettings.extend.

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.LegendContainer
symbols.description:
The LegendContainer control uses the NavContainer control to handle hierarchical navigation between legend sections. The LegendContainer control contains an initial navigation page. Both the initial navigation page and legend sections are Page controls, We put the List Legend control inside the Page control internally.

If you only add one legend, the initial navigation page won't display. Whenever you open legend container, the legend container will restore the page last time you quit with.

properties.name: enableFlatLegends
properties.description:
shows all the list legends in flat structure instead of navigation list. restriction - will work only with list legends.

Since: 1.92.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Height of the legend navigation. When the height specified is smaller than a section content, a vertical scroll bar appears.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Width of the legend navigation. When the width specified is smaller than a section content, a horizontal scroll bar appears.width of the legend navigation. When the width specified is smaller than a section content, a horizontal scroll bar appears.

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.ListLegendItem
symbols.description: Aggregation element for the List Legend. A List Legend Item consists of a marker and an associated text. The marker can be any shapes you in shape aggregation. If you need to interact with the legend item, set the interactive to true then the item will display a check box in front of the shape and text.

properties.name: interactive
properties.description: Indicates whether the check box is visible or not.

properties.name: selected
properties.description: Indicates whether the check box is selected or not.

properties.name: visible
properties.description:
Indicates whether the list item is visible

Since: 1.92.

aggregations.name: legendShapeGroup
aggregations.description:
Defines a Legend Shape Group class for the List Legend Item. The shapes are normalized in the rendering phase.

Since: 1.84.

aggregations.name: shape
aggregations.description: Define a shape class for the List Legend Item. The shape will be normalized in the rendering phase.

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.PrintConfig
symbols.description: PrintConfig is a class that holds the configuration for the print page.

parameters.name: printConfiguartionObject
parameters.description:
The print configuration object can have keys as pageConfig, textConfig, marginConfig, durationConfig, exportConfig and with values as defined in below structure.

    pageConfig - The page configuration object with the following given keys.
  • paperSize: Possible values are "A0" | "A1" | "A2" | "A3" | "A4" | "A5" | "Letter" | "Legal" | "Tabloid" | "Custom". Select one of the provided values as the paper size of the print page. Default value is "A4".
  • unit: Possible values are "mm" | "cm" | "in". Select one of the provided values as the unit for paper and margin measurements. Default value is "mm" for all paper size except "Letter", "Legal", "Tabloid" where default value is "in".
  • paperHeight: It must be a number, and it must be the unit specified within the page configuration. It is considered only when paper size is "Custom". If paper size is not provided, then the default value is height of the "A4" paper size.
  • paperWidth: It must be a number, and it must be the unit specified within the page configuration. It is considered only when the paper size is "Custom". If paper size is not provided, then "A4" is the default width.
  • portrait: It must be a boolean value as it is the orientation of the page. Default value is true.
  • showPageNumber: It must be a boolean value. It decides if the page number is to be displayed. Default value is false. Not applicable in single page API.
    textConfig - The text configuration with the following given keys.
  • showHeaderText: It must be a boolean value. It is a flag to decide whether to show the header text or not in the print page. Default value is false.
  • showFooterText: It must be a boolean value. It is a flag to decide whether to show the footer text or not in the print page. Default value is false.
  • headerText: It must be a string value to display header text in the print page. Default value is empty string.
  • footerText: It must be a string value to display footer text in the print page. Default value is empty string.
    marginConfig - The margin configuration object with the following given keys.
  • marginType: Possible values are "custom" | "none" | "default". Select one of the provided values for the margin type of the print page. Default value is "default".
  • marginLeft: It must be a number and it must be in the unit specified within the page configuration. It is considered only when margin type is set as "custom". When the margin type is "default", the default value is "5mm". If "none" is maintained, then the value is "0".
  • marginBottom: It must be a number and it must be in the unit specified within the page configuration. It is considered only when margin type is set as "custom". When the margin type is "default", the default value is "5mm". If "none" is maintained, then the value is "0".
  • marginRight: It must be a number and it must be in the unit specified within the page configuration. It is considered only when margin type is set as "custom". When the margin type is "default", the default value is "5mm". If "none" is maintained, then the value is "0".
  • marginTop: It must be a number and it must be in the unit specified within the page configuration. It is considered only when margin type is set as "custom". When the margin type is "default", the default value is "5mm". If "none" is maintained, then the value is "0".
  • marginLocked: It must be a boolean value. If set to true, it signifies all four margins get synced on the same value. If the value is provided by the application, the margin top is considered for all four margins. Default value is false and considered only when the margin type is "custom".
    durationConfig - The duration configuration object with following given keys.
  • duration: Possible values are "all" | "week" | "month" | "custom". Select the date duration of the print page. Default value is "all".
    • If the provided value is "all", then the total horizon is set as duration. Values provided in "startDate" and "endDate" are ignored.
    • If the provided value is "week", then the next week is set as duration. Values provided in "startDate" and "endDate" are ignored.
    • If the provided value is "month", then the next month is set as duration. Values provided in "startDate" and "endDate" are ignored.
    • If the provided value is "custom", then the value provided in "startDate" and "endDate" is set as duration.
  • startDate: This is a UI5 date object. It is the start date of a print page. It is considered only when the "duration" is set as "custom".
  • endDate: This is a UI5 date object. It is the end date of a print page. It is considered only when the "duration" is set as "custom".
    exportConfig - The export configuration object with the following given keys.
  • exportAsJPEG: It must be a boolean value. It is a flag to decide whether to export the pdf as a JPEG or not. Default value is true, which means that the exported PDF has content in a JPEG image format. This is not applicable for single page API.
  • exportRange: It must be a string value such as, '0,1". It is the range of the export. This is not applicable for a single page API and when "exportAll" is set to true.
  • exportAll: It must be a boolean value. It is a flag to decide whether to export all the pages or not. Default value is true. This is not applicable for a single page API.
  • compressionQuality: It must be a number between the range of 1 to 100. The quality of the compression is applicable only when "exportAsJPEG" is set to true. Default value is 75. This is not applicable for a single page API.
  • scale: It must be a number between the range of 50 to 100. This is to scale the export up or down. Default value is 100. This is not applicable for a single page API.
  • multiplePage: It must be a boolean value. It is a flag to decide whether if the export is multiple page. This is not applicable for a single page API.
    If the configuration is incorrect, errors with the following codes are shown.
  • TYPE_ERROR - If the type of the property is not as expected.
  • RANGE_ERROR - If the value of the property is not in the expected range or not in the list specified.
  • REQUIRED_ERROR - If the required property is missing.

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.shapes.Shape
symbols.description:
Base class for all standard shapes.

This class provides the common used properties and methods useful for shape rendering. Use this class as a parent of your custom shape implementations.

properties.name: color
properties.description: Color to be used for rendering the shape.

properties.name: height
properties.description:
Height defines the vertical length of the shape.

By default, the system automatically generates the shape height according to the base row height. You can set the height yourself by using the setter method. However, it cannot exceed the row height.

properties.name: hoverable
properties.description: All standard shapes are hoverable.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.71.2. replaced by sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape The property and its default value, that is set to 'false', are being inherited from the parent BaseShape.

properties.name: selectable
properties.description: All standard shapes are selectable.
properties.deprecatedText: Deprecated as of version 1.71.2. replaced by sap.gantt.simple.BaseShape The property and its default value, that is set to 'false', are being inherited from the parent BaseShape.

properties.name: startX
properties.description: The x position of the shapes start. Auto will be converted to position based on time.

properties.name: width
properties.description: The horizontal width of a shape. Auto will be converted to width calculated from time and endTime.

parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.ShapeStyle
symbols.description: class handles style properties for shapes. Different styles can be defined for different event states.

properties.name: eventState
properties.description:
This property defines the event for which the style should be applied. This is a mandatory field. For example, if the eventState is "dragDrop", the style is applied to ghost image of shape on drag.

Since: 1.130.

properties.name: fill
properties.description:
For shapes and text, the fill property is a presentation attribute that defines the color (or any SVG paint server like gradients or patterns)

Since: 1.130.

properties.name: name
properties.description:
The name of the Shape style. This is a mandatory field. The name should be unique.

Since: 1.130.

properties.name: stroke
properties.description:
The stroke property is a presentation property defining the color (or any SVG paint servers like gradients or patterns) used to paint the outline of the shape.

Since: 1.130.

properties.name: strokeDasharray
properties.description:
The strokeDasharray property is a presentation property defining the pattern of dashes and gaps used to paint the outline of the shape.

Since: 1.130.

properties.name: strokeWidth
properties.description:
The strokeWidth property is a presentation property defining the width of the stroke to be applied to the shape.

Since: 1.130.

properties.name: textFill
properties.description:
Text color property.

Since: 1.130.

properties.name: visible
properties.description:
Visibility of the shape.

Since: 1.130.

parameters.description: ID of the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.StockChartPeriod
symbols.description:
StockChartPeriod is used by sap.gantt.simple.StockChart It represents a time period that a specific stock usages If the tooltip aggregation is defined for a stock chart period, it is used to render the tooltip. If explicitly set to " ", no tooltip is shown. If the tooltip aggregation is not provided, a default tooltip is displayed in the format - dimension name:period value.

StockChartPeriod is defined as an aggregation of sap.gantt.simple.StockChartDimension

symbols.title: class sap.gantt.simple.UtilizationDimension

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.UtilizationLineChart
symbols.description:
Utilization Line Chart (ULC) is a complex shape, you can use it to visualize resource utilization on different dimensions. Each Utilization dimension is represented by a line, you could define different colors for each dimension.

You can define the ULC background by property fill, the default background color is light gray

properties.name: showMiddleLine
properties.description: Flag to show or hide the middle line in Utilization Line Chart. The value of the overConsumptionMargin will affect the middle line position. By default the middle line is a gray dashed line

associations.name: overConsumptionPattern
associations.description:
The value for overConsuptionPattern can be either an UI5 ID which points to an instance of PatternBase which defined in svgDefs or an instance of PatternBase.

The overConsumptionPattern is visualized as rectangle which the height is calculated based on overConsumptionMargin

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.VisibleHorizonUpdateSubType
symbols.description:
This specifies the sub reason detailing why the visible horizon is changing

This enum is part of the 'sap/gantt/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'simple.VisibleHorizonUpdateSubType'.

properties.name: sap.gantt.simple.VisibleHorizonUpdateSubType.NotApplicable
properties.description: Default value of VisibleHorizonUpdateSubType when VisibleHorizonUpdateType is other than ZoomLevelChanged.

properties.name: sap.gantt.simple.VisibleHorizonUpdateSubType.ZoomIn
properties.description: The Visible horizon is updated when zoomed in.

properties.name: sap.gantt.simple.VisibleHorizonUpdateSubType.ZoomOut
properties.description: The Visible horizon is updated when zoomed out.

symbols.title: enum sap.gantt.simple.VisibleHorizonUpdateSubType

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.VisibleHorizonUpdateType
symbols.description:
This type specifies the reason why visible horizon is changing.

This enum is part of the 'sap/gantt/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'simple.VisibleHorizonUpdateType'.

properties.name: sap.gantt.simple.VisibleHorizonUpdateType.HorizontalScroll
properties.description: The visible horizon is updated when a user scrolls using the Gantt chart horizontal scroll bar.

properties.name: sap.gantt.simple.VisibleHorizonUpdateType.InitialRender
properties.description: The visible horizon is updated when Gantt chart gets rendered (which is triggered by an onAfterRenderer event) and needs to set visible horizon based on the chart configuration.

properties.name: sap.gantt.simple.VisibleHorizonUpdateType.MouseWheelZoom
properties.description: The update is triggered by the user scrolling horizontally with a mouse wheel (Ctrl + Shift + mouse wheel).

properties.name: sap.gantt.simple.VisibleHorizonUpdateType.SyncVisibleHorizon
properties.description: The update is triggered by the sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartContainer. This update is used to keep all Gantt charts in one container in sync. When the user performs an action that changes the visible horizon, an event with the action type is fired on the original Gantt chart and SyncVisibleHorizon gets fired on all other Gantt charts in the container.

properties.name: sap.gantt.simple.VisibleHorizonUpdateType.TimePeriodZooming
properties.description: An update happens when the user selects a time period using the Z key + mouse.

properties.name: sap.gantt.simple.VisibleHorizonUpdateType.TotalHorizonUpdated
properties.description: The visible horizon is updated when the total horizon of a Gantt chart changes or is set. Changes in total horizon may affect the visible horizon as well.

properties.name: sap.gantt.simple.VisibleHorizonUpdateType.ZoomLevelChanged
properties.description: The visible horizon is updated when the zoom level is changed, either by the user or the application.

symbols.title: enum sap.gantt.simple.VisibleHorizonUpdateType

properties.description: yAxis column has threshold and label with width of 124px.

properties.name: sap.gantt.simple.yAxisColumnContent.ThresholdwithLabelandUOM
properties.description: yAxis column has threshold, label and UOM with Width of 192px.

properties.name: sap.gantt.simple.yAxisColumnContent.ThresholdwithUOM
properties.description: yAxis column has threshould and UOM with width of 128px.

Day-wise non working time. These intervals are going to be skipped for the specified day.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.axistime.AxisTimeStrategyBase
nodes.description: Base class for all zoom strategies.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.axistime.FullScreenStrategy
nodes.description:
FullScreenStrategy

A zoom strategy that sets the value of totalHorizon to the value of visibleHorizon. When this strategy is implemented, visibleHorizon is fixed. Because of this, when you scroll the splitter to expand or shrink the chart area, the value of visibleHorizon remains intact, which makes shapes look larger or smaller accordingly. Moreover, the horizontal scroll bar never appears and the zoom control is deactivated.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.axistime.ProportionZoomStrategy
nodes.description:
ProportionZoomStrategy

A zoom strategy that provides the proportional change ability. Proportional change ensures that Gantt Chart dynamically adjusts the zoom rate to be the best fit for rendering shapes in the chart area. This strategy cannot be used by the Select control.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.simple.LegendShapeGroup
nodes.description: Legend Shape Group class for accommodating multiple shapes in ListLegendItem.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.simple.LegendShapeGroupOrientation
nodes.description: Predefined orientations for the sap.gantt.simple.LegendShapeGroup control.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.simple.ListLegend
nodes.description: The Legend is a popup window in the GanttChart control wich can be used to display shape/icon-text pairs.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.simple.ListLegendItem
nodes.description: Aggregation element for the List Legend.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.simple.MarkerType
nodes.description: Predefined marker types for the sap.gantt.simple.AdhocLine control.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.simple.MultiActivityGroup
nodes.description: Multi Activity Group class uses SVG tag 'g'.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.simple.MultiActivityRowSettings
nodes.description: Enables users to define a shape aggregation name of their own.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.simple.PrintConfig
nodes.description: PrintConfig is a class that holds the configuration for the print page.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.simple.PrintDialogTemplate
nodes.description: Enables the user to define print dialog footer buttons.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.simple.Relationship
nodes.description: Enables users to visualize the relationship between visiable objects.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.simple.relationshipShapeSize
nodes.description:
Size of shapes in the relationship

This enum is part of the 'sap/gantt/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'simple.relationshipShapeSize'.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.simple.RelationshipType
nodes.description: Type of relationship shape.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.simple.shapeEventType
nodes.description: Defines eventType for Shape style configuration.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.simple.ShapeScheme
nodes.description: The ShapeScheme class will be defined as an aggregation on sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable It's used to determine the overall row height, the expandable shapes row height

nodes.name: sap.gantt.simple.ShapeStyle
nodes.description: class handles style properties for shapes.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.simple.StockChart
nodes.description: Stock Chart (SC) is a complex shape, you can use it to visualize stock utilization on different dimensions.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.simple.StockChartDimension
nodes.description: Used for creating a utilization dimension for the sap.gantt.simple.StockChart It's derived from the sap.ui.core.Element

nodes.name: sap.gantt.simple.StockChartPeriod
nodes.description: StockChartPeriod is used by sap.gantt.simple.StockChart It represents a time period that a specific stock usages If the tooltip aggregation is defined for a stock chart period, it is used to render the tooltip.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.simple.UtilizationBarChart
nodes.description:
Utilization Bar Chart (UBC) is a complex shape, you can use it to visualize a resource the capacity and actual consumption of a resource.

There is a `line` in UBC to visualize the actual capacity consumption, you can change the `line` color by property stroke

nodes.name: sap.gantt.simple.UtilizationChart
nodes.description: UtilizationChart is an abstract base class which inherits by UtilizationLineChart and UtilizationBarChart.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.simple.UtilizationDimension
nodes.description: Used for creating a utilization dimension for the sap.gantt.simple.UtilizationLineChart It's derived from the sap.ui.core.Element

nodes.name: sap.gantt.simple.UtilizationLineChart
nodes.description: Utilization Line Chart (ULC) is a complex shape, you can use it to visualize resource utilization on different dimensions.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.simple.UtilizationPeriod
nodes.description:
UtilizationPeriod is used by sap.gantt.simple.UtilizationLineChart and sap.gantt.simple.UtilizationBarChart It represents a time period that a specific resource utilization usages

UtilizationPeriod is either defined as a direct aggregation of UtilizationBarChart, or an aggregation of sap.gantt.simple.UtilizationDimension

nodes.name: sap.gantt.simple.verticalTextAlignment
nodes.description: Configuration options for vertical alignment of title of the shape representing a Task.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.simple.VisibleHorizonUpdateSubType
nodes.description:
This specifies the sub reason detailing why the visible horizon is changing

This enum is part of the 'sap/gantt/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'simple.VisibleHorizonUpdateSubType'.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.simple.VisibleHorizonUpdateType
nodes.description: This type specifies the reason why visible horizon is changing.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.simple.yAxisColumnContent
nodes.description: Configaration option for yAxis Column.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.simple.shapes.Shape
nodes.description: Base class for all standard shapes.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.simple.shapes.ShapeAlignment
nodes.description: Configuration options for vertical alignment of shape representing a Task.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.simple.shapes.Task
nodes.description: A shape representing one task.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.simple.shapes.TaskType
nodes.description: Type of task shape.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.skipTime.DayInterval
nodes.description: Enables the user to define skip time pattern within a day.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.skipTime.SkipInterval
nodes.description: Enables the user to define skip time interval.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.skipTime.SkipPattern
nodes.description: Enables the user to define skip time pattern.

nodes.name: sap.gantt.skipTime.WeekPattern
nodes.description: Enables the user to define weekly skip pattern.
